cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles east of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: slowly turning north then northeast, aiming toward the Mississippi/Alabama Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi‐Alabama border (around Biloxi/Pensacola area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane and tropical-storm watches extend from southeast Louisiana eastward to portions of the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings from Morgan City, LA, to Navarre, FL; tropical-storm warnings east to Indian Pass, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible in outer rain bands
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the southeast Florida coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer bands could drop 1–3 inches of rain through Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and higher surf along Atlantic beaches
